pageContext.claim: “Since the election, we've created a number that I would have said during the campaign, the fake news just back there would have said this is crazy, 5.3 million new jobs, over now 600,000 beautiful brand-new manufacturing jobs that were never going to come back to our country.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump, as usual, exaggerates the number of jobs created in his presidency by counting from the election, not when he took office. There have been nearly 4.9 million jobs created and about 436,000 manufacturing jobs in his term. There has been steady growth in jobs since the Great Recession, though manufacturing job growth had stalled in the year before Trump's election. Moreover, despite the recent gains, the number of manufacturing jobs is still nearly 1 million below the level at the start of the Great Recession in December 2007.
